article:
Chris Hipkins

Chris Hipkins is a New Zealand politician who served as the Prime Minister of New Zealand from 2023. He has been a member of the Labour Party since 2001 and has held various positions within the party and the government.

# Early life

Chris Hipkins was born on May 5, 1978, in Napier, New Zealand. He grew up in a working-class family and was educated at Napier Boys' High School. Hipkins developed an interest in politics at a young age and was involved in student politics during his time at university. He went on to earn a Master's degree in public administration from Massey University.

# In Opposition, 2008–2017

## Standing as a parliamentary candidate (2008)

In 2008, Hipkins announced his candidacy for the Labour Party in the Napier electorate. He won the party's nomination and went on to secure the seat in the 2008 general election. Hipkins was one of the youngest members of parliament at the time, and his victory was seen as a significant win for the Labour Party in a traditionally conservative area.

## First term (2008–2011)

In his first term, Hipkins was a junior minister in the Labour government. He served as the Associate Minister of Education and the Associate Minister of Transport. Hipkins was responsible for a number of key policy initiatives during this time, including the introduction of a new national curriculum and the implementation of a national transport plan.

## Second term (2011–2014)

In the 2011 general election, Hipkins retained his seat and was promoted to a senior ministerial position. He served as the Minister of Education and the Minister of Defence. Hipkins played a key role in the Labour Party's education policy, including the introduction of a new teacher training scheme and the establishment of a national education standards authority.

## Third term (2014–2017)

In the 2014 general election, Hipkins retained his seat but was not promoted to a senior ministerial position. He served as the Minister of State Services and the Minister of Veterans' Affairs. Hipkins was responsible for a number of key policy initiatives during this time, including the introduction of a new public service reform program and the establishment of a national veterans' affairs authority.

# In Government (2017–2023)

## Fourth term (2017–2020)

In the 2017 general election, the Labour Party won a majority government, and Hipkins was promoted to a senior ministerial position. He served as the Minister of Education and the Minister of State Services. Hipkins played a key role in the Labour Party's education policy, including the introduction of a new education funding model and the establishment of a national education commission.

## Fifth term (2020–2023)

In the 2020 general election, the Labour Party won a second consecutive majority government, and Hipkins was promoted to the position of Deputy Prime Minister. He served as the Deputy Prime Minister and the Minister of Health. Hipkins played a key role in the Labour Party's response to the COVID-19 pandemic, including the introduction of a number of public health measures and the establishment of a national vaccine program.

# Prime Minister (2023)

## Nomination and appointment

In 2023, Hipkins was nominated as the leader of the Labour Party and was subsequently appointed as the Prime Minister of New Zealand. He succeeded Chris Luxon as Prime Minister and became the 41st Prime Minister of New Zealand.

## Domestic affairs

As Prime Minister, Hipkins has prioritized a number of key domestic policy initiatives, including the introduction of a new housing affordability package and the establishment of a national climate change commission. He has also committed to increasing the minimum wage and improving working conditions for low-paid workers.

## Foreign affairs

As Prime Minister, Hipkins has emphasized the importance of maintaining strong relationships with New Zealand's key trading partners, including Australia and the Pacific Islands. He has also committed to increasing New Zealand's involvement in international peacekeeping and humanitarian efforts.

## 2023 general election

In the 2023 general election, Hipkins led the Labour Party to a third consecutive majority government. The Labour Party won a significant number of seats, including a number of key battleground electorates.

# In Opposition (2023–present)

In 2023, Hipkins announced that he would be stepping down as Prime Minister and leader of the Labour Party. He was succeeded by Adrian Rurawhe, who became the new leader of the Labour Party. Hipkins has since become a member of the Labour Party's shadow cabinet, where he serves as the Shadow Minister of Health.

# Political views

Hipkins has a number of key policy positions, including a commitment to increasing the minimum wage, improving working conditions for low-paid workers, and introducing a new housing affordability package. He has also emphasized the importance of maintaining strong relationships with New Zealand's key trading partners and increasing New Zealand's involvement in international peacekeeping and humanitarian efforts.

# Public image

Hipkins has a reputation as a hardworking and dedicated politician. He is known for his strong work ethic and his commitment to getting things done. Hipkins has also been praised for his ability to connect with ordinary New Zealanders and his willingness to listen to their concerns.

# Personal life

Hipkins is married to his wife, Jessica, and they have two children together. He is a keen sportsman and enjoys playing cricket and rugby in his spare time. Hipkins is also a passionate advocate for a number of social causes, including climate change and social justice.

Football at the 2022 Asian Games – Men's tournament

The men's football tournament at the 2022 Asian Games was the 18th edition of the Asian Games' men's football tournament. It took place from September 25 to October 8, 2022, in Hangzhou, China.

# Competition schedule

The competition schedule was announced by the Asian Games Organizing Committee on September 1, 2022. The tournament featured 16 teams competing in a group stage, followed by a knockout stage. The group stage consisted of four groups of four teams each, with the top two teams from each group advancing to the knockout stage.

# Venues

The men's football tournament was played at the following venues in Hangzhou:

* Hangzhou Olympic Sports Center Stadium
* Binjiang Sports Centre Stadium
* Xiaoshan Sports Centre Stadium
* Linping Sports Centre Stadium

# Draw

The draw for the men's football tournament took place on August 14, 2022. The 16 teams were divided into four pots based on their Asian Football Confederation (AFC) rankings. The top two teams from each pot were drawn into Groups A and B, while the third and fourth teams from each pot were drawn into Groups C and D.

# Squads

Each team was allowed to register a squad of 20 players, consisting of two goalkeepers, six defenders, six midfielders, and six forwards. The squads were announced by the teams prior to the start of the tournament.

* Group A: Australia, China, Iran, Lebanon

**2023–24 UEFA Champions League qualifying phase and play-off round**

The 2023–24 UEFA Champions League qualifying phase and play-off round is the first stage of the 2023–24 UEFA Champions League, a club football competition organised by UEFA. The draw for the qualifying phase and play-off round took place on June 23, 2023, at the UEFA headquarters in Nyon, Switzerland. A total of 55 teams will compete in the qualifying phase and play-off round, with the 32 winners of the play-off round advancing to the group stage.

**Teams**

The teams that entered the qualifying phase and play-off round are divided into two paths: the Champions Path and the League Path.

### Champions Path

The Champions Path consists of teams that finished as Champions in their respective domestic leagues in the last five seasons. The teams that entered the Champions Path are:

* 16 teams that finished as Champions in their respective domestic leagues in the 2022–23 season
* 4 teams that finished as runners-up in their respective domestic leagues in the 2022–23 season and did not qualify for the Champions League as Champions
* 4 teams that finished as group winners in the UEFA Champions League qualifying play-offs in the 2022–23 season

### League Path

The League Path consists of teams that finished outside the top two in their respective domestic leagues in the last five seasons. The teams that entered the League Path are:

* 55 teams that finished outside the top two in their respective domestic leagues in the 2022–23 season

## Format

The qualifying phase and play-off round will be played in a knockout format, with each tie contested over two legs. The team that scores more goals on aggregate over the two legs will advance to the next round. If the score is tied on aggregate after the two legs, the away goals rule will be applied. If the score is still tied after the away goals rule has been applied, the tie will be decided by a penalty shootout.

## Schedule

The qualifying phase and play-off round will be played between June 27 and August 30, 2023. The schedule for the qualifying phase and play-off round is as follows:

* Preliminary round: June 27–28
* First qualifying round: July 11–12
* Second qualifying round: July 25–26
* Third qualifying round: August 1–2
* Play-off round: August 15–16

## Preliminary round

The preliminary round will be contested by the lowest-ranked teams in the Champions Path and the lowest-ranked teams in the League Path.

### Seeding

The teams that entered the preliminary round were seeded based on their UEFA coefficient ranking.

### Bracket

The teams that entered the preliminary round were drawn into two brackets: Bracket A and Bracket B. The teams in each bracket played each other in a home-and-away tie.

### Summary

The preliminary round was contested by 8 teams in Bracket A and 8 teams in Bracket B. The winners of each bracket advanced to the first qualifying round.

### Semi-finals

The winners of each bracket advanced to the semi-finals, where they played each other in a home-and-away tie.

### Final

The winners of the semi-finals advanced to the final, where they played each other in a home-and-away tie.

## First qualifying round

The first qualifying round will be contested by the winners of the preliminary round and the next lowest-ranked teams in the Champions Path and the League Path.

### Seeding

The teams that entered the first qualifying round were seeded based on their UEFA coefficient ranking.

### Summary

The first qualifying round will be contested by 40 teams in the Champions Path and 40 teams in the League Path. The winners of each tie will advance to the second qualifying round.

### Matches

The teams that entered the first qualifying round played each other in a home-and-away tie.

## Second qualifying round

The second qualifying round will be contested by the winners of the first qualifying round and the next lowest-ranked teams in the Champions Path and the League Path.

### Seeding

The teams that entered the second qualifying round were seeded based on their UEFA coefficient ranking.

### Summary

The second qualifying round will be contested by 20 teams in the Champions Path and 20 teams in the League Path. The winners of each tie will advance to the third qualifying round.

### Champions Path

The teams that entered the second qualifying round in the Champions Path played each other in a home-and-away tie.

### League Path

The teams that entered the second qualifying round in the League Path played each other in a home-and-away tie.

## Third qualifying round

The third qualifying round will be contested by the winners of the second qualifying round and the next lowest-ranked teams in the Champions Path and the League Path.

### Seeding

The teams that entered the third qualifying round were seeded based on their UEFA coefficient ranking.

### Summary

The third qualifying round will be contested by 10 teams in the Champions Path and 10 teams in the League Path. The winners of each tie will advance to the play-off round.

### Champions Path

The teams that entered the third qualifying round in the Champions Path played each other in a home-and-away tie.

### League Path

The teams that entered the third qualifying round in the League Path played each other in a home-and-away tie.

## Play-off round

The play-off round will be contested by the winners of the third qualifying round and the teams that finished as runners-up in their respective domestic leagues in the 2022–23 season.

article:
**History of Fantasy**

Fantasy is a genre of fiction that has been a part of human culture for thousands of years, evolving from ancient mythologies and folklores to the complex and diverse forms of modern fantasy literature, art, and media. This article explores the history of fantasy, tracing its development from the earliest fantastic works to the modern forms of fantasy that dominate popular culture today.

**Differences between fantasy and earlier fantastic works**

While fantasy is often associated with the supernatural, the irrational, and the fictional, earlier works of literature and mythology also featured fantastical elements. However, the key difference between these earlier works and modern fantasy is the level of self-awareness and deliberate creation of a fictional world. In earlier works, fantastical elements were often embedded in a historical or mythological context, whereas modern fantasy typically creates a separate, fictional world with its own rules and logic.

In ancient Greece, for example, mythology was a vital part of everyday life, and fantastical creatures like the Minotaur and the Chimera were an integral part of the mythological landscape. However, these creatures were not created for entertainment purposes but were seen as explanations for natural phenomena or the workings of the gods. Similarly, medieval romances and chivalric tales featured fantastical elements, but these were often justified within a framework of Christian morality and the chivalric code.

In contrast, modern fantasy often blurs the boundaries between reality and fantasy, creating a separate, fictional world that is designed to entertain and engage the reader or audience. This shift in attitude towards fantasy reflects a growing awareness of the power of storytelling and the importance of imagination in shaping our understanding of the world.

**Development of fantasy**

The development of fantasy as a distinct genre can be seen in three main phases: the Romances, the Enlightenment, and Romanticism.

### **Romances**

During the Middle Ages, romance was a popular form of literature that often featured fantastical elements. These tales of chivalry and adventure, such as Sir Thomas Malory's _Le Morte d'Arthur_ and Geoffrey Chaucer's _The Canterbury Tales_, were often set in a world of magic and wonder, where knights and ladies played out their roles in a fantastical landscape. While these works were not self-consciously "fantasy" in the modern sense, they helped lay the groundwork for later developments in the genre.

### **The Enlightenment**

The Enlightenment marked a significant shift in attitudes towards fantasy and the supernatural. As rationalism and empiricism gained prominence, fantastical elements were often seen as a relic of a bygone era, a sign of superstition and ignorance. Writers like Voltaire and David Hume dismissed fantasy as a form of "bad reasoning" and encouraged readers to focus on the rational and the scientific. However, this rejection of fantasy also laid the groundwork for later developments in the genre, as writers began to explore the possibilities of fantasy as a form of social commentary and critique.

### **Romanticism**

Romanticism, which emerged in the late 18th and early 19th centuries, marked a significant turning point in the development of fantasy. Writers like Mary Shelley, John Keats, and Percy Bysshe Shelley explored the possibilities of fantasy as a form of art and imagination, often incorporating elements of horror, the supernatural, and the irrational. Works like Mary Shelley's _Frankenstein_ and John Keats's _The Eve of St. Agnes_ helped establish fantasy as a major literary genre, paving the way for later developments in the genre.

**Modern fantasy**

Modern fantasy has its roots in the 19th century, but it is the 20th century that saw the rise of fantasy as a major literary and cultural force. This section explores the three main phases of modern fantasy: Pre-Tolkien, Tolkien, and Post-Tolkien.

### **Pre-Tolkien**

Before J.R.R. Tolkien's _The Lord of the Rings_, fantasy was often associated with children's literature, fairy tales, and mythology. Writers like Andrew Lang and W.H. Auden explored the possibilities of fantasy, but their works were often seen as minor or marginal. However, this period also saw the rise of fantasy in other forms, such as pulp fiction and science fiction. Writers like H.G. Wells and Edgar Rice Burroughs helped establish fantasy as a major genre in popular culture, paving the way for later developments.

### **Tolkien**

J.R.R. Tolkien's _The Lord of the Rings_ (1954-1955) marked a significant turning point in the development of modern fantasy. Tolkien's creation of Middle-earth, a fully realized and detailed fantasy world, helped establish fantasy as a major literary genre. His use of mythology, linguistics, and world-building helped create a sense of depth and complexity that had not been seen before in fantasy. Tolkien's influence can be seen in many later works of fantasy, from the works of C.S. Lewis to the modern fantasy novels of George R.R. Martin.

### **Post-Tolkien**

The post-Tolkien era saw a significant expansion of fantasy in popular culture, with the rise of fantasy novels, films, and television series. Writers like Ursula K. Le Guin, Neil Gaiman, and Patrick Rothfuss explored new themes and ideas in fantasy, often incorporating elements of science fiction, horror, and mythology. The rise of urban fantasy, which combines fantasy with modern-day settings and themes, also saw a significant expansion in the genre. Works like _The Dresden Files_ and _The Hollows_ series helped establish urban fantasy as a major genre, paving the way for later developments.

**References**

For further reading on the history of fantasy, see:

* _The Oxford Handbook of Fantasy Literature_ edited by Farah Mendlesohn and Evan Ellenberg
* _The Cambridge Companion to Fantasy Literature_ edited by Edward James and Farah Mendlesohn
* _The Evolution of Fantasy Literature_ by Brian Attebery
* _The Genre of Fantasy_ by Farah Mendlesohn
* _The History of Fantasy_ by Michael Drayton

Note: This article is not a comprehensive bibliography, but rather a selection of relevant sources for further reading.

World Baseball Classic

The World Baseball Classic (WBC) is an international baseball tournament sanctioned by the World Baseball Softball Confederation (WBSC). It is held every four years, with the first tournament taking place in 2006. The tournament features national teams from around the world, competing in a round-robin and knockout format.

Background

The concept of an international baseball tournament dates back to the 1930s, but it was not until the 1990s that the idea gained momentum. The WBSC, which was then known as the International Baseball Federation (IBAF), began exploring the possibility of an international tournament. The first World Baseball Classic was initially proposed for 2001, but it was delayed due to various reasons, including the 9/11 terrorist attacks and the subsequent decline in baseball popularity in the United States.

History

2006–09: Samurai Japan's back-to-back championships

The first World Baseball Classic was held in 2006, with 16 national teams participating. The tournament was won by Japan, who defeated Cuba in the final. Samurai Japan, as they are nicknamed, went on to win the championship again in 2009, defeating South Korea in the final.

article:
Free substitution is a tactical strategy used in various sports where players can be replaced by teammates during the game, often without a significant interruption in play. This concept has evolved over time, with different sports adopting varying degrees of substitution rules to balance the need for player safety, team strategy, and game flow.

## Sports that allow free substitution

Some sports permit free substitution during live play, allowing teams to make changes to their lineup at any time. This approach is often seen in sports with a strong emphasis on strategy and player rotation, where teams aim to exploit specific player matchups or create favorable game situations.

### Examples of sports with free substitution

* Basketball: In most professional and collegiate basketball leagues, teams can substitute players freely during stoppages in play or between possessions. This allows coaches to adjust their lineup, manage player fatigue, and exploit defensive weaknesses.
* Volleyball: Similar to basketball, volleyball teams can make substitutions during stoppages in play or between rotations. This enables coaches to rotate players, create favorable matchups, and exploit defensive vulnerabilities.
* Water Polo: In water polo, teams can make substitutions during stoppages in play or between quarters. This allows coaches to rotate players, manage player fatigue, and exploit defensive weaknesses.

## Sports that allow unlimited substitutions during stoppages of play only

Some sports permit unlimited substitutions during stoppages in play, but not during live play. This approach balances the need for player safety and team strategy with the need to maintain game flow.

### Examples of sports with unlimited substitutions during stoppages of play

* American Football: In the National Football League (NFL) and most collegiate football leagues, teams can make unlimited substitutions during stoppages in play, such as between plays or during timeouts. However, teams are limited to a certain number of players on the field at any given time.
* Rugby: In most forms of rugby, teams can make substitutions during stoppages in play, such as between scrums or lineouts. However, teams are limited to a certain number of players on the field at any given time.
* Hockey (Field and Ice): In field hockey and ice hockey, teams can make substitutions during stoppages in play, such as between goals or during timeouts. However, teams are limited to a certain number of players on the field or ice at any given time.

## Sports with limited substitution

Some sports impose restrictions on the number of substitutions allowed during the game, which can create strategic challenges for teams.

### Examples of sports with limited substitutions

* Soccer: In most professional and collegiate soccer leagues, teams are limited to three substitutions per game, with the option to make additional substitutions during stoppages in play for injured players.
* Cricket: In most forms of cricket, teams are limited to two substitutions per innings, with the option to make additional substitutions during stoppages in play for injured players.
* Baseball: In most professional and collegiate baseball leagues, teams are limited to three substitutions per game, with the option to make additional substitutions during stoppages in play for injured players.

## Sports that only allow substitution to replace injured players

Some sports permit substitution only to replace injured players, which can create strategic challenges for teams.

### Examples of sports with substitution only for injured players

* Boxing: In professional boxing, fighters can only substitute if they are injured and unable to continue the fight.
* Wrestling: In professional wrestling, competitors can only substitute if they are injured and unable to continue the match.
* Martial Arts: In many martial arts competitions, competitors can only substitute if they are injured and unable to continue the match.

## Sports with mixed or hybrid systems

Some sports have mixed or hybrid systems, where different rules apply depending on the level of competition or the specific game situation.

### Examples of sports with mixed or hybrid systems

* Australian Rules Football: In Australian Rules football, teams are limited to a certain number of substitutions during the game, but can make unlimited substitutions during stoppages in play for injured players.
* Gaelic Football: In Gaelic football, teams are limited to a certain number of substitutions during the game, but can make unlimited substitutions during stoppages in play for injured players.
* Netball: In netball, teams are limited to a certain number of substitutions during the game, but can make unlimited substitutions during stoppages in play for injured players.

## See also

* Player rotation
* Player safety
* Game flow
* Tactical strategy
* Sports rules

## Notes

* The specific rules and regulations for free substitution can vary depending on the level of competition and the specific sport.
* In some sports, teams may be able to make additional substitutions during stoppages in play for injured players, but may be limited to a certain number of substitutions overall.
* The rules for free substitution can also vary depending on the specific game situation, such as during overtime or during the final minutes of the game.

**Ghost Trick: Phantom Detective**

Ghost Trick: Phantom Detective is a puzzle-adventure game developed by Shu Takumi and published by Capcom. Released in 2010 for the Nintendo DS, the game follows the story of a young man named Sissel who becomes a "phantom detective" after his death.

**Gameplay**

Gameplay in Ghost Trick: Phantom Detective involves solving puzzles to progress through the story. The game's protagonist, Sissel, has the ability to possess objects and use their abilities to interact with the environment. The game is divided into chapters, each with its own set of puzzles to solve. Players must use their wits to solve these puzzles, often by manipulating objects in the environment to reach hidden items or unlock new paths.

One of the unique features of Ghost Trick is its use of time manipulation. Sissel can rewind, fast-forward, and pause time to solve puzzles and avoid obstacles. This mechanic is used in creative ways throughout the game, often requiring players to think outside the box and come up with innovative solutions.

The game also features a " Phantom Detective" mode, where players take on the role of a detective who must solve a murder mystery. This mode is separate from the main story and features its own set of puzzles and challenges.

**Plot**

The game's story follows Sissel, a young man who is on his way to meet his girlfriend, Lisette, when he is killed in a car accident. However, instead of dying, Sissel becomes a "phantom detective," a spirit who can possess objects and use their abilities to interact with the environment.

As Sissel navigates the world as a phantom, he discovers that he has the ability to manipulate time and use it to his advantage. He soon learns that he is not alone in the world, and that there are other phantoms like him who are also trying to solve a mystery.

Throughout the game, Sissel encounters a cast of characters who are all struggling with their own personal demons. He must use his abilities to help them and uncover the truth behind their struggles. As he delves deeper into the mystery, Sissel discovers that he has a connection to the world that he had not previously realized.

**Development**

Ghost Trick: Phantom Detective was developed by Shu Takumi, a renowned game designer who is also known for his work on the Ace Attorney series. Takumi was inspired by the works of Alfred Hitchcock and the film "Rear Window" when creating the game's story and gameplay.

**Art and Game Design**

The game's art style is a unique blend of cartoonish and realistic elements. The characters are designed to be visually striking and memorable, with each one having their own distinct personality. The environments are also well-designed, with a focus on creating a sense of atmosphere and immersion.

One of the standout features of the game's art design is its use of color. The game features a bold and vibrant color palette, with a focus on blues and purples to create a sense of mystery and intrigue. The game's UI is also well-designed, with a clear and intuitive interface that makes it easy to navigate the game's many puzzles.

**Music and Sound Design**

The game's soundtrack was composed by Masumi Tanaka, a renowned composer who is known for his work on the Ace Attorney series. The soundtrack is a fitting accompaniment to the game's story and gameplay, with a focus on creating a sense of tension and suspense.

The sound design in the game is also noteworthy, with a focus on creating a sense of immersion and atmosphere. The game's sound effects are well-designed, with a focus on creating a sense of realism and authenticity.

**Release**

Ghost Trick: Phantom Detective was released in 2010 for the Nintendo DS. The game received critical acclaim for its unique gameplay mechanics, engaging story, and well-designed art and sound.

**Mobile Ports**

**2023 Remaster**

Ghost Trick: Phantom Detective received widespread critical acclaim upon its release. Reviewers praised the game's unique gameplay mechanics, engaging story, and well-designed art and sound. The game has a 94% approval rating on GameRankings, with many reviewers praising its creative and challenging puzzles.

The game has also been a commercial success, selling over 1 million copies worldwide. The game has also received several awards and accolades, including the 2011 Nintendo DS Game of the Year award.

**Legacy**

Ghost Trick: Phantom Detective has had a lasting impact on the gaming industry. The game's unique gameplay mechanics and engaging story have influenced many other puzzle-adventure games. The game has also been praised for its originality and creativity, with many reviewers citing it as one of the most innovative and memorable games of all time.

article:
**2023 SAG-AFTRA Strike**

The 2023 SAG-AFTRA strike was a labor strike by the Screen Actors Guild-American Federation of Television and Radio Artists (SAG-AFTRA) against the Alliance of Motion Picture and Television Producers (AMPTP), which represents the major film and television studios in the United States. The strike began on July 14, 2023, and lasted for 137 days, ending on October 28, 2023.

**Introduction**

The 2023 SAG-AFTRA strike was the largest labor dispute in the history of the American entertainment industry. The strike was sparked by a dispute over wage and working conditions, as well as a desire for greater creative control and residual payments for actors and other performers. The strike had significant implications for the film and television industry, with many productions halted or delayed due to the walkout.

**Background**

### **Unionization in Hollywood**

The Screen Actors Guild (SAG) was founded in 1933 by a group of actors who sought to establish a union to negotiate better wages and working conditions. In 2012, the SAG and the American Federation of Television and Radio Artists (AFTRA) merged to form SAG-AFTRA, which now represents over 160,000 members in the entertainment industry. SAG-AFTRA is one of the largest and most influential labor unions in the United States.

### **Pre-strike activity**

In the months leading up to the strike, SAG-AFTRA leaders and members engaged in a series of negotiations with the AMPTP over various issues, including wage increases, residual payments, and working conditions. These negotiations were unsuccessful, and the union leadership decided to authorize a strike, which was overwhelmingly approved by the membership.

**Timeline**

### **July**

The strike began on July 14, 2023, with a rally in Los Angeles and picket lines set up outside major studios and production facilities. The first major production to be affected by the strike was the Netflix series "Stranger Things," which was forced to shut down production due to the walkout.

### **August**

In August, the strike continued, with SAG-AFTRA members picketing outside studios and production facilities across the country. The union also launched a series of protests and rallies in major cities, including New York, Los Angeles, and Chicago.

### **September**

In September, the AMPTP offered a proposal to the SAG-AFTRA leadership, which included a 10% wage increase and improved working conditions. However, the union rejected the offer, citing concerns over residual payments and creative control.

### **October**

In October, the strike continued, with SAG-AFTRA members picketing outside studios and production facilities across the country. The union also launched a series of protests and rallies in major cities, including New York, Los Angeles, and Chicago.

### **November**

In November, the AMPTP offered a revised proposal to the SAG-AFTRA leadership, which included a 12% wage increase and improved working conditions. However, the union rejected the offer, citing concerns over residual payments and creative control.

### **December**

In December, the strike continued, with SAG-AFTRA members picketing outside studios and production facilities across the country. The union also launched a series of protests and rallies in major cities, including New York, Los Angeles, and Chicago.

**Strike activity and responses**

### **Locations**

The strike affected productions across the country, with SAG-AFTRA members picketing outside studios and production facilities in major cities, including Los Angeles, New York, Chicago, and Miami.

### **Media executives' response**

The media executives responded to the strike by offering concessions, including wage increases and improved working conditions. However, the union rejected these offers, citing concerns over residual payments and creative control.

### **Politicians' response**

Several politicians, including California Governor Gavin Newsom and New York City Mayor Eric Adams, expressed support for the SAG-AFTRA strike and the union's demands.

### **Other unions' response**

Several other unions, including the Writers Guild of America and the Directors Guild of America, expressed support for the SAG-AFTRA strike and the union's demands.

### **Other organizations' response**

Several other organizations, including the National Association of Theatre Owners and the Producers Guild of America, expressed opposition to the SAG-AFTRA strike and the union's demands.

### **Impact**

The strike had significant implications for the film and television industry, with many productions halted or delayed due to the walkout. The strike also had an impact on the economy, with some estimates suggesting that the strike cost the industry over $1 billion in lost revenue.

**Aftermath**

The strike ended on October 28, 2023, with the SAG-AFTRA and AMPTP reaching a tentative agreement on a new contract. The agreement included wage increases, improved working conditions, and greater creative control for actors and other performers. article:
**George Meade**

George Gordon Meade (December 31, 1815 – November 6, 1872) was a United States Army officer and civil engineer who served as a general in the Union Army during the American Civil War. He is best known for leading the Union Army to victory in the Battle of Gettysburg in July 1863, considered a turning point in the war. Meade's military career spanned over three decades, including service in the Mexican-American War and several notable battles in the American Civil War.

**Early life and education**

George Meade was born in Cádiz, Spain, to Richard Worsam Meade and Elizabeth Hazeltine Meade. His father was an American merchant who served as the United States consul in Cádiz. Meade's family moved to Philadelphia when he was four years old, and he spent his childhood in the United States. He attended the University of Pennsylvania, graduating in 1835 with a degree in civil engineering. Meade then worked as a civil engineer in the United States Corps of Topographical Engineers, where he was involved in several projects, including the construction of the Erie Canal.

**Topographical Corps and Mexican-American War**

Meade joined the United States Corps of Topographical Engineers in 1836 and served in several posts throughout the United States. In 1846, during the Mexican-American War, Meade was appointed as a lieutenant in the Topographical Corps and served as a cartographer and engineer. He participated in several battles, including the Battle of Monterrey, where he was wounded in the leg. Meade's experiences during the war laid the foundation for his future military career.

**American Civil War**

Meade played a significant role in the American Civil War, serving in several key battles and campaigns.

### **Peninsula campaign**

In 1862, Meade was appointed as a brigadier general and served in the Peninsula campaign under General George McClellan. He participated in several battles, including the Battle of Williamsburg, where he was wounded in the arm. Meade's leadership and bravery during the campaign earned him recognition and promotion.

### **Maryland campaign**

In September 1862, Meade led a division of troops in the Maryland campaign, where he played a key role in the Battle of South Mountain. He was promoted to major general in October 1862 and served as the commander of the V Corps.

### **Fredericksburg and Chancellorsville**

In December 1862, Meade's V Corps fought in the Battle of Fredericksburg, where they suffered heavy casualties. In May 1863, Meade's corps fought in the Battle of Chancellorsville, where they were defeated by General Robert E. Lee's Army of Northern Virginia.

### **Gettysburg campaign**

In July 1863, Meade was appointed as the commander of the Army of the Potomac, replacing General Joseph Hooker. He led the army in the Gettysburg campaign, which culminated in the Battle of Gettysburg. Meade's leadership and strategic decisions during the battle were instrumental in the Union victory.

#### **Command of the Army of the Potomac**

Meade's command of the Army of the Potomac began on June 28, 1863, and continued until the end of the war. He faced significant challenges, including the defeat of his army at the Battle of Gettysburg and the subsequent retreat of Lee's army. Meade's leadership and decision-making during this period were crucial in maintaining the morale and cohesion of the army.

#### **Battle of Gettysburg**

The Battle of Gettysburg was a turning point in the war, and Meade's leadership played a significant role in the Union victory. He made several key decisions, including the decision to attack the Confederate army on the third day of the battle. Meade's leadership and bravery during the battle earned him recognition and praise from his contemporaries.

#### **Lee's retreat**

After the Battle of Gettysburg, Lee's army retreated to the south, and Meade's army pursued them. Meade's leadership and decision-making during this period were instrumental in maintaining the momentum of the Union army. He continued to pursue Lee's army, eventually forcing them to retreat to Virginia.

### **Bristoe and Mine Run campaign**

In October 1863, Meade's army fought in the Bristoe campaign, where they suffered heavy casualties. In November 1863, Meade's army fought in the Mine Run campaign, where they were defeated by Lee's army.

### **Overland campaign**

In May 1864, Meade's army fought in the Overland campaign, where they clashed with Lee's army in several battles, including the Battle of the Wilderness and the Battle of Cold Harbor.

### **Richmond-Petersburg campaign**

In June 1864, Meade's army fought in the Richmond-Petersburg campaign, where they besieged Lee's army in Richmond and Petersburg. Meade's leadership and decision-making during this period were instrumental in maintaining the momentum of the Union army.

### **Political rivalries**

Meade had several political rivals during the war, including General Joseph Hooker and General George McClellan. Meade's leadership and decision-making during the war earned him recognition and praise from his contemporaries, but also created tensions with his rivals.

**Reconstruction**

After the war, Meade played a significant role in the Reconstruction period. He served as the commander of the Military Division of the Atlantic and was involved in several Reconstruction efforts, including the establishment of the Freedmen's Bureau.

**Personal life**

Meade was married to Margaretta Sergeant Meade and had two children with her. He was a close friend of General George McClellan and served as his aide-de-camp during the Mexican-American War.

**Later life and death**

Meade died on November 6, 1872, at his home in Philadelphia. He was 56 years old at the time of his death.

**Legacy**

Meade's legacy is that of a skilled and brave military leader who played a significant role in the American Civil War. He is best known for his leadership during the Battle of Gettysburg, where he led the Union Army to victory. Meade's leadership and decision-making during the war earned him recognition and praise from his contemporaries, and he is remembered as one of the greatest generals of the Civil War.

## **Memorials to Meade**

Several memorials have been erected to commemorate Meade's life and legacy. The most notable of these is the Meade Monument, which was erected in Gettysburg, Pennsylvania, in 1889. The monument is a large granite structure that features a statue of Meade and several inscriptions that commemorate his life and service.

**In popular culture**

Meade has been featured in several works of fiction, including the novel "Gettysburg" by Jeff Shaara and the film "Gettysburg" (1993) directed by Ronald F. Maxwell. He has also been the subject of several biographies and historical studies.

article:
She-Hulk: Attorney at Law

She-Hulk: Attorney at Law is a television series developed by Jessica Gao for the Disney+ streaming service. The show is a spin-off of the Marvel Cinematic Universe (MCU) and serves as a solo vehicle for the character of Jennifer Walters, also known as She-Hulk. The series premiered on August 18, 2022, and consists of nine episodes.

Premise

The series follows the life of Jennifer Walters, a lawyer who gains superhuman strength after receiving a blood transfusion from her cousin, Bruce Banner. As She-Hulk, Jennifer must navigate her new life as a superhero and her career as a lawyer, all while dealing with the challenges of her personal life. The show explores themes of identity, power, and the complexities of being a female superhero.

Cast and characters

* Tatiana Maslany as Jennifer Walters / She-Hulk
* Ginger Gonzaga as April Taylor
* Josh Segarra as Augustus "Pug" Puglia
* Jameela Jamil as Titania
* Renée Elise Goldsberry as Mallory Book
* Mark Ruffalo as Bruce Banner / Hulk
* Benedict Wong as Wong
* Tim Roth as Emil Blonsky / Abomination
* Charlie Cox as Matt Murdock / Daredevil
* Mark Linn-Baker as Morris
* David Pasquesi as Todd

Episodes

1. "A Normal Amount of Rage"
2. "Mommy Quarterly"
3. "The People v. Emil Blonsky"
4. "Is This Not Real Magic?"
5. "Mean, Green, and Straight Poured into These Jeans"
6. "Just Jen"
7. "The People v. J. Scott"
8. "Ribbit and Rip It"
9. "Whose Show Is This?"

Production

### Development

She-Hulk: Attorney at Law was first announced in July 2020, with Jessica Gao serving as the showrunner and executive producer. Gao had previously worked on the MCU series Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D. and was a fan of the She-Hulk character. She aimed to create a show that would be a "fun, irreverent, and witty" take on the character.

### Writing

The writing team for the series consisted of Jessica Gao, Kari Drake, and Jordan Roberts, among others. Gao has stated that she wanted to create a show that would be a "love letter" to the MCU and the character of She-Hulk. The team drew inspiration from a variety of sources, including classic TV shows and movies, as well as their own personal experiences.

### Casting

Tatiana Maslany was cast as Jennifer Walters / She-Hulk in December 2020. Maslany is a Canadian actress known for her work on the TV series Orphan Black, where she played multiple clones. Gao has stated that she was drawn to Maslany's versatility and ability to play complex characters.

### Design

The costume design for She-Hulk was created by costume designer Jamie Walker. Walker aimed to create a costume that would be both functional and fashionable. The show's color palette is predominantly green and black, with a focus on bold and bright colors.

### Filming

Filming for the series took place in Los Angeles, California. The production team used a combination of practical and CGI effects to bring the show's superheroes to life. Gao has stated that she wanted to create a show that would be a "mix of reality and fantasy."

### Post-production

Post-production for the series took place at a number of studios in Los Angeles. The show's editor, Jeffrey Ford, aimed to create a cohesive and engaging visual style for the series. Ford has stated that he wanted to create a show that would be both "fun and visually stunning."

### Music

The show's score was composed by Amie Doherty and Mark Isham. Doherty is a composer and musician known for her work on a number of TV shows and movies. Isham is a composer and musician who has worked on a number of high-profile projects, including the MCU.

Marketing

She-Hulk: Attorney at Law was first promoted through a series of teasers and trailers released on Disney+. The show's marketing campaign focused on the character of Jennifer Walters and her journey as a superhero. The show's tagline, "She's not just a superhero, she's a lawyer," was also used to promote the show.

Release

The series premiered on August 18, 2022, on Disney+. The first episode, "A Normal Amount of Rage," was released at 12:01 a.m. EST. The show was released as a weekly series, with new episodes released every Thursday.

Reception

### Viewership

She-Hulk: Attorney at Law was a moderate success in terms of viewership. The show's premiere episode drew 9.4 million viewers, with a 0.5 rating in the 18-49 demographic. The show's viewership declined over the course of the season, with the final episode drawing 3.6 million viewers.

### Critical response

The show received generally positive reviews from critics. The show holds a 64% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, with many praising its witty dialogue and strong performances. However, some critics felt that the show's pacing was uneven and that it struggled to balance its tone.

### Accolades

She-Hulk: Attorney at Law was nominated for a number of awards, including a Critics' Choice Television Award for Best Actress in a Comedy Series for Tatiana Maslany.

Documentary special

A documentary special, She-Hulk: Attorney at Law - Assembling a Superhero, was released on Disney+ in October 2022. The special explores the making of the series and features interviews with the cast and crew.

Future

The future of She-Hulk: Attorney at Law is uncertain. In November 2022, it was announced that the show would not be renewed for a second season. However, Marvel Studios has not ruled out the possibility of a spin-off or a continuation of the show in some form.

Notes

She-Hulk: Attorney at Law is a unique take on the She-Hulk character and explores themes of identity and power in a way that is both fun and thought-provoking. The 2022 French presidential election was held on 10 and 24 April 2022. The election was the 13th presidential election in the Fifth Republic and saw the re-election of incumbent President Emmanuel Macron.

# Electoral System

The French presidential election uses a two-round system, where the candidate with the most votes in the first round proceeds to the second round, regardless of whether they receive a majority of the vote. The candidate with the most votes in the second round is declared the winner.

# First Round

Winnie-the-Pooh: Blood and Honey is a 2022 British horror film directed by Chris Barton-Stubbs, written by Chris Barton-Stubbs, and starring Paul McCaffrey and Natasha Radski. The film is a dark reimagining of the classic children's stories of Winnie-the-Pooh.

**Introduction**

Winnie-the-Pooh: Blood and Honey is a horror film that deviates from the traditional depiction of A.A. Milne's beloved characters. The film's unique approach has generated significant attention and controversy among fans of the original stories. This article provides an overview of the film's production, marketing, and reception.

**Plot**

article:
**Glass Onion: A Knives Out Mystery**

Glass Onion: A Knives Out Mystery is a 2022 American whodunit mystery film directed, written, and produced by Rian Johnson. The film is the sequel to Johnson's 2019 film Knives Out and stars Daniel Craig as Detective Benoit Blanc. The film follows a complex web of relationships and alliances as a group of wealthy and influential individuals gather on a private island for a murder mystery game, only to find themselves embroiled in a real-life murder investigation.

# Plot

The film takes place several years after the events of Knives Out and follows a new, standalone story. Detective Benoit Blanc is invited to the private island of Miles Bron, a billionaire tech mogul, for a murder mystery game. Bron has invited a group of his closest friends and acquaintances, including his associates, his romantic partners, and his children, to play the game, but things quickly take a dark turn when one of the guests is found dead.

As the investigation unfolds, Blanc must navigate a complex web of relationships, alliances, and rivalries among the guests to uncover the truth behind the murder. Along the way, he uncovers secrets and lies that threaten to destroy the reputations of the guests and expose the dark underbelly of their seemingly perfect lives.

# Cast

The film features an ensemble cast, including:

* Daniel Craig as Detective Benoit Blanc
* Edward Norton as Miles Bron

# Production

## Development

Glass Onion: A Knives Out Mystery was first announced in January 2020, with Rian Johnson set to write and direct the film. The film was initially planned as a sequel to Knives Out, with Daniel Craig reprising his role as Detective Benoit Blanc. In July 2020, the film was delayed due to the COVID-19 pandemic, and Johnson was given the green light to create a standalone sequel.

## Writing

Johnson began writing the script for Glass Onion in the summer of 2020, drawing inspiration from a variety of sources, including classic whodunits, film noir, and mystery novels. He aimed to create a film that would be both a standalone sequel to Knives Out and a tribute to the classic whodunit genre.

## Casting

The casting process for Glass Onion began in the fall of 2020, with Johnson working closely with the actors to develop their characters. Edward Norton was cast as Miles Bron, a billionaire tech mogul, and Janelle Monáe was cast as Andi Brand, a former business partner of Bron's.

## Filming

Principal photography for Glass Onion began in April 2021 on the island of Kauai, Hawaii. Johnson shot the film on location, using a combination of natural light and elaborate sets to create the film's unique atmosphere. The film's cast and crew worked in a bubble to minimize the risk of COVID-19 transmission.

## Music

The score for Glass Onion was composed by Nathan Johnson, who also worked on the score for Knives Out. The film's soundtrack features a mix of classical and modern music, including pieces by Bach and Beethoven, as well as a range of contemporary artists.

# Release

## Marketing

The marketing campaign for Glass Onion was launched in the fall of 2022, with a series of trailers and promotional materials released to build hype for the film's release. The campaign focused on the film's complex plot, its ensemble cast, and its unique atmosphere.

## Theatrical and Streaming

Glass Onion: A Knives Out Mystery was released in theaters on November 23, 2022, and simultaneously on streaming platforms. The film was released in a range of formats, including IMAX, Dolby Cinema, and 3D.

## Home Media

Glass Onion: A Knives Out Mystery was released on DVD and Blu-ray in April 2023, featuring a range of bonus features, including deleted scenes, behind-the-scenes footage, and commentary from the cast and crew.

# Reception

## Box Office

Glass Onion: A Knives Out Mystery was a commercial success, grossing over $150 million worldwide on its opening weekend. The film went on to gross over $400 million worldwide, making it one of the highest-grossing films of 2022.

## Critical Response

Glass Onion: A Knives Out Mystery received widespread critical acclaim, with many praising its complex plot, its ensemble cast, and its unique atmosphere. The film holds a 92% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, with an average rating of 8.2/10.

## Themes

The film explores a range of themes, including the complexities of human relationships, the dangers of wealth and power, and the fragility of identity. The film's use of a murder mystery plot allows it to explore these themes in a unique and engaging way.

## Accolades

article:
**Seymour Hersh**

Seymour Myron Hersh is an American investigative journalist and author who has been a prominent figure in the field of investigative journalism for over five decades. Born on April 8, 1937, in Chicago, Illinois, Hersh is best known for his groundbreaking investigations into the Vietnam War, the Iran-Contra affair, and the mistreatment of Iraqi prisoners at Abu Ghraib.

**Early life and education**

Hersh grew up in a Jewish family in Chicago's South Side. His father, Jacob Hersh, was a dairyman, and his mother, Dora (née Rosenfeld), was a homemaker. Hersh's early life was marked by poverty and hardship, but his parents instilled in him a strong work ethic and a love of learning. He attended South Shore High School, where he developed a passion for writing and journalism.

After graduating from high school in 1954, Hersh attended the University of Chicago, where he studied English literature and began to develop his skills as a writer. He dropped out of college in 1956 to join the U.S. Army, where he served for two years as a mortar gunner in the 8th Infantry Division in Europe.

**Newspaper career**

After his stint in the army, Hersh returned to Chicago and began working as a reporter for the _South Chicago Journal_. In 1962, he joined the _St. Louis Post-Dispatch_ as a general-assignment reporter. Two years later, he moved to the _Chicago Sun-Times_, where he became a city hall reporter.

In 1966, Hersh joined the _New York Times_ as a national correspondent. During his time at the _Times_, he became known for his aggressive and dogged reporting style, which earned him a reputation as one of the most talented young journalists in the country.

**My Lai massacre**

One of Hersh's most notable stories broke in 1969, when he exposed the My Lai massacre, in which American soldiers killed hundreds of unarmed Vietnamese civilians in the village of My Lai. Hersh's reporting, which was based on interviews with soldiers and eyewitnesses, revealed that the massacre was a deliberate and premeditated act of violence, rather than a isolated incident of hysteria.

The My Lai story was a major scandal, and it led to widespread outrage and calls for accountability. Hersh's reporting was instrumental in bringing the story to light, and it earned him widespread acclaim and recognition.

**The New York Times**

Hersh's reporting at the _New York Times_ continued to make headlines throughout the 1970s. In 1972, he exposed the secret bombing of Cambodia, a story that led to widespread protests and calls for an end to the Vietnam War. He also reported on the Pentagon Papers, a secret study of the Vietnam War that was leaked to the _Times_ by Daniel Ellsberg.

**Investigative books: 1980s and 1990s**

In the 1980s and 1990s, Hersh turned to book-length investigations, publishing several critically acclaimed books on a range of topics. _The Price of Power: Kissinger in the Nixon White House_ (1983) was a biography of Henry Kissinger that explored his role in the Nixon administration. _The Samson Option: Israel's Nuclear Arsenal and America Foreign Policy_ (1991) was a book about Israel's nuclear program and its impact on U.S. foreign policy.

**Later investigations**

In the 2000s and 2010s, Hersh continued to make headlines with his investigative reporting. He exposed the Abu Ghraib prison abuse scandal in 2004, revealing that American soldiers had engaged in widespread torture and abuse of Iraqi prisoners. He also reported on the Iran-Contra affair, a scandal in which the Reagan administration secretly sold arms to Iran and used the proceeds to fund anti-Sandinista rebels in Nicaragua.

**Iraq and Abu Ghraib**

Hersh's reporting on Abu Ghraib was a major scandal, revealing that American soldiers had engaged in widespread torture and abuse of Iraqi prisoners. The story, which was published in _The New Yorker_ in 2004, led to widespread outrage and calls for accountability.

**Iran**

In 2008, Hersh reported on the U.S. government's secret plans to attack Iran, which were based on false intelligence about Iran's nuclear program. The story, which was published in _The New Yorker_, revealed that the Bush administration had been planning to attack Iran for years, but had been unable to gain approval from Congress.

**Syria and chemical attacks**

In 2013, Hersh reported on the Syrian government's use of chemical weapons against civilians, which had been denied by the Syrian government. The story, which was published in _The London Review of Books_, revealed that the Syrian government had used chemical weapons on multiple occasions, despite claims to the contrary.

**Killing of Osama bin Laden**

In 2015, Hersh reported on the U.S. government's claims about the killing of Osama bin Laden, which he said were exaggerated and inaccurate. The story, which was published in _The London Review of Books_, revealed that the U.S. government had claimed to have killed bin Laden in a firefight, when in fact he had likely been killed by a severe health condition.

**Nord Stream pipeline and Ukraine**

In 2022, Hersh reported on the U.S. government's alleged sabotage of the Nord Stream pipeline, which he said was a deliberate act of terrorism. The story, which was published in _Substack_, revealed that the U.S. government had been planning to sabotage the pipeline for years, despite claims to the contrary.

**Other statements**

In addition to his investigative reporting, Hersh has also made headlines with his public statements. In 2016, he spoke out against the murder of Seth Rich, a Democratic National Committee staffer who was killed in a mysterious shooting. Hersh said that Rich's murder was a setup by the Russian government, and that the story had been covered up by the U.S. government.

In 2018, Hersh also spoke out against the abuse of Pat Nixon, the wife of former President Richard Nixon, who he said had been subjected to mental and emotional abuse by her husband.

**Use of anonymous sources**

Hersh has been criticized for his use of anonymous sources in his reporting. In 2013, he was accused of relying too heavily on unnamed sources in his reporting on the Syrian government's use of chemical weapons. However, Hersh has also said that he has a responsibility to protect his sources, and that he will not reveal their identities unless it is necessary to do so.

**Personal life**

Hersh is married to Tamar Hersh, a journalist and editor. They have two children together, and live in Washington, D.C. Hersh is a self-described liberal, and has been a vocal critic of the U.S. government's foreign policy.

**Awards and honors**

Hersh has won numerous awards for his reporting, including the Pulitzer Prize, the George Polk Award, and the National Magazine Award. He has also received several honorary degrees, including from the University of Chicago and the University of Michigan.

**Publications**

Hersh has published several books and articles on a range of topics. His books include _The Price of Power: Kissinger in the Nixon White House_ (1983), _The Samson Option: Israel's Nuclear Arsenal and America Foreign Policy_ (1991), and _Chain of Command: The Road from 9/11 to Abu Ghraib_ (2004). His articles have appeared in _The New Yorker_, _The London Review of Books_, and _The New York Times_.

article:
E.A.T. (TV program)

E.A.T. is a Philippine television variety show broadcast by TV5 and Radio Philippines Network (RPN). The program is a revival of the original Eat Bulaga! format, which was previously aired on GMA Network from 1995 to 2024. E.A.T. premiered on April 15, 2024, and is currently hosted by Vic Sotto, Tito Sotto, Joey de Leon, and other members of the Eat Bulaga! cast.

# History

## RPN (1979–1989)

E.A.T.'s roots can be traced back to the 1970s when it was known as Eat Bulaga!, a noontime variety show that was first aired on RPN in 1979. The program was created by Vic Sotto, Joey de Leon, and RPN's then-Executive Vice President, Roberto Benedicto. Eat Bulaga! quickly gained popularity and became a staple in Philippine television, known for its unique format, entertaining segments, and popular guests.

## ABS-CBN (1989–1995)

In 1989, Eat Bulaga! moved to ABS-CBN after RPN lost its franchise. During its six-year run on ABS-CBN, the program continued to enjoy massive success and became a household name. However, in 1995, the show's contract with ABS-CBN expired, and it moved to GMA Network.

## GMA Network (1995–2024)

Eat Bulaga!'s move to GMA Network marked a new chapter in the program's history. The show continued to thrive and became one of the network's flagship programs. Over the years, Eat Bulaga! underwent several format changes and introduced new segments, including the popular "Eat Bulaga! Olympics" and "Bawal! Judgmental Ka Ba?". However, in 2023, GMA Network and the show's producers announced that Eat Bulaga! would be ending its run on the network after 29 years.

## TVJ - TAPE Inc. conflict (2023–2024)

The decision to end Eat Bulaga!'s run on GMA Network was met with controversy when it was revealed that the show's producers, TVJ (Vic Sotto, Joey de Leon, and Tito Sotto), had a disagreement with the network over the program's format and ownership. TAPE Inc., the production company behind Eat Bulaga!, had been leasing the program's format to GMA Network for years, but the network allegedly refused to renew the lease. As a result, TVJ decided to take the program to RPN, where they would produce and broadcast it under the new title, E.A.T.

## E.A.T. and TAPE's Eat Bulaga!

The move to RPN marked a new beginning for the Eat Bulaga! franchise, with TVJ retaining creative control over the program. However, the new version of the show, E.A.T., was met with skepticism by some fans who felt that the program had lost its original charm. In an effort to address these concerns, TVJ introduced new segments, including "Sugod Bahay, Mga Kapatid!" and "Gimme 5: Laro ng mga Henyo", which were designed to appeal to a younger audience.

## Eat Bulaga! trademark battle: TVJ emerges victorious

As part of the dispute between GMA Network and TVJ, the network attempted to trademark the Eat Bulaga! name and logo. However, the Philippine Intellectual Property Office (IPO) ultimately ruled in favor of TVJ, allowing them to retain the trademark for the program.

## TV5 and RPTV (since 2024)

In 2024, TV5 and Radio Philippines Network (RPN) announced that they would be partnering to produce and broadcast E.A.T. The program would be simulcast on both networks, with TV5 serving as the primary broadcast partner.

# Hosts

## Current host

The current hosts of E.A.T. include Vic Sotto, Tito Sotto, Joey de Leon, and other members of the Eat Bulaga! cast. The program also features a rotating cast of guest hosts and performers.

## Former host

Some former hosts of Eat Bulaga! include Vic Sotto, who left the program in 1989 to pursue other projects, and Joey de Leon, who took a break from the show in 1995 to focus on other business ventures.

# Segments

## Current segments

E.A.T. features a range of current segments, including:

### Sugod Bahay, Mga Kapatid!

This segment, which translates to "House Guests, Brothers and Sisters", features a rotating cast of guest hosts and performers who visit the show's set and participate in various games and challenges.

### Gimme 5: Laro ng mga Henyo

In this segment, a team of contestants compete in a series of challenges and games, with the goal of winning cash prizes and other rewards.

### Peraphy

This segment, which translates to "Perfection", features a team of contestants who compete to see who can complete a series of challenges and tasks with the greatest speed and accuracy.

### Barangay Bulagaan

This segment, which translates to "Bulagaan Barangay", features a team of contestants who compete to see who can complete a series of challenges and tasks related to community service and volunteer work.

### Dear Eat Bulaga

In this segment, viewers can submit their letters and messages to the show, which are then read aloud on air.

### Eat Bulaga Olympics

This segment features a series of challenges and games that contestants must complete in order to win cash prizes and other rewards.

### Bawal! Judgmental Ka Ba?

This segment, which translates to "Forbidden! Are You Judgmental?", features a team of contestants who compete to see who can complete a series of challenges and tasks related to self-improvement and personal growth.

## Concluded segments

Some concluded segments of Eat Bulaga! include:

### Mr. Cutie: Boys Got Talent

This segment, which was a spin-off of the popular "Mr. Cutie" segment, featured a team of young contestants who competed to see who could complete a series of challenges and tasks related to singing, dancing, and other forms of performance.

### Babala! 'Wag Kayong Ganuuun... (2023–2024)

This segment, which translates to "Warning! Don't Say That...", featured a team of contestants who competed to see who could complete a series of challenges and tasks related to language and communication.

### That's My Boyfriend (2024)

This segment, which was a spin-off of the popular "That's My Boyfriend" segment, featured a team of contestants who competed to see who could complete a series of challenges and tasks related to relationships and dating.

### Rewind: The Comeback Stage (2024)

This segment, which was a spin-off of the popular "Rewind" segment, featured a team of contestants who competed to see who could complete a series of challenges and tasks related to music and performance.

### EB Centerstage

This segment, which was a spin-off of the popular "Eat Bulaga!" segment, featured a team of contestants who competed to see who could complete a series of challenges and tasks related to music and performance.

### Barangay Cinema: Child Star of the Year (2024)

This segment, which was a spin-off of the popular "Barangay Cinema" segment, featured a team of young contestants who competed to see who could complete a series of challenges and tasks related to acting and performance.

# Ratings

E.A.T. has consistently high ratings since its premiere in 2024. According to Nielsen Media Research, the program has averaged a rating of 15% in the national urban market, making it one of the top-rated programs in the country.

# Controversies

E.A.T. has been involved in several controversies since its premiere in 2024. Some of the notable controversies include:

* The program's decision to feature a segment that some viewers felt was insensitive to the victims of a recent natural disaster.
* The program's use of a segment that some viewers felt was a rip-off of a popular international program.
* The program's decision to feature a guest host who was accused of making racist and sexist comments.

# Spin-offs

E.A.T. has several spin-offs, including:

* Eat Na Ta!
* International versions of Eat Bulaga!, including:
	+ Eat Bulaga! Indonesia and The New Eat Bulaga! Indonesia
	+ Eat Bulaga! Myanmar

# Notes

E.A.T. is a revival of the original Eat Bulaga! format, which was previously aired on GMA Network from 1995 to 2024. The program is currently broadcast on TV5 and Radio Philippines Network (RPN).

This article does not include any references.

article:
Gilles de Rais

Gilles de Rais (1404-1440) was a French nobleman and military leader who rose to prominence during the Hundred Years' War. He was a companion-in-arms of Joan of Arc and a member of the House of Retz, a powerful noble family in medieval France.

# House of Retz

## Early life
Gilles de Rais was born on 1404 in Champtocé, Maine, to Guy de Rais, a knight, and Marie de Craon, a member of the Craon family. He was the youngest of three children and was raised in a wealthy and influential family. His early life was marked by a strict Catholic upbringing, which would later influence his actions and decisions.

## Matrimonial projects
In 1420, Gilles de Rais married Catherine de Thouars, daughter of Guy XIV, Count of Thouars. The marriage was arranged by his family to secure an alliance with the powerful House of Thouars. However, the marriage was short-lived, and Catherine died in 1423, leaving Gilles de Rais a widower.

## Family disputes
Gilles de Rais's family was marked by disputes and power struggles. His older brother, Renaud de Rais, was a rival for power and influence, and the two brothers often clashed. These disputes would later contribute to Gilles de Rais's downfall.

## Titles, estates and wealth
As a member of the House of Retz, Gilles de Rais inherited significant wealth and titles. He was the Seigneur of Champtocé and the Baron of Maulévrier, among other titles. His family's wealth and influence gave him a strong position in medieval society.

# Military career

## First hypothetical feat of arms
Gilles de Rais's military career began in 1426, when he led a successful campaign against the English in Maine. This campaign was marked by a significant victory at the Battle of Pontorson, which earned him recognition and praise from his contemporaries.

## Franco-Breton alliance through the House of Valois-Anjou
In 1427, Gilles de Rais formed an alliance with the Breton nobility through the House of Valois-Anjou. This alliance was a key factor in his rise to prominence and provided him with significant military and economic resources.

## Guerilla warfare against English garrisons on the borders of Maine
Gilles de Rais led a series of successful guerrilla campaigns against English garrisons on the borders of Maine. These campaigns earned him a reputation as a skilled and ruthless military leader.

## Companion in arms with Joan of Arc
In 1429, Gilles de Rais became a companion-in-arms of Joan of Arc, who had arrived in Orleans to lead the French army against the English. Gilles de Rais played a key role in the Siege of Orleans, leading a series of successful assaults against the English lines.

## Civil wars between La Trémoille and Richemont's allies
In 1430, Gilles de Rais found himself caught up in a series of civil wars between the factions of La Trémoille and Richemont's allies. These conflicts would mark the beginning of his downfall.

## Lifting of the siege of Lagny
In 1430, Gilles de Rais led a successful campaign to lift the siege of Lagny, which had been laid by the English. This campaign marked a significant victory for the French army and earned Gilles de Rais further recognition.

## Reduction of military commitments
In the early 1430s, Gilles de Rais began to reduce his military commitments, focusing instead on his personal interests and wealth. This marked a significant shift in his priorities and would contribute to his later downfall.

# Squandering of heritage

Gilles de Rais's wealth and influence were squandered through a series of reckless and extravagant expenditures. He invested heavily in various business ventures, including a failed textile mill, and spent lavishly on his personal interests, including the purchase of a large collection of rare books and art.

# Criminal life

## Occult involvement
Gilles de Rais was known to have been involved in occult practices, including alchemy and astrology. These interests would later contribute to his reputation as a heretic and sorcerer.

## Child murders
Gilles de Rais was accused of murdering several children, who were reportedly killed during rituals and ceremonies. These accusations would later form a key part of his trial and execution.

## Act of force in Saint-Étienne-de-Mer-Morte
In 1435, Gilles de Rais was accused of committing an act of force in Saint-Étienne-de-Mer-Morte, which involved the abduction and murder of several children. This incident marked a significant turning point in his downfall.

## Ecclesiastical and secular investigations
Gilles de Rais was the subject of several ecclesiastical and secular investigations, which focused on his alleged crimes and heresies. These investigations would ultimately lead to his trial and execution.

## Trial and execution
Gilles de Rais was tried and executed in 1440, on charges of heresy, sodomy, and murder. His trial was marked by a series of gruesome confessions, which implicated him in a range of crimes.

# Question of guilt

## Doubts about the verdict in the Age of Enlightenment tradition
In the Age of Enlightenment, there were significant doubts about the verdict in Gilles de Rais's trial. Many scholars questioned the reliability of the confessions and the fairness of the trial.

## Occultist interpretations
Gilles de Rais's trial and execution have been interpreted by some as a persecution of witches and heretics. These interpretations have been influential in the development of modern occultism.

## Georges Bataille's interpretations

January 2023 Speaker of the United States House of Representatives election

The 2023 Speaker of the United States House of Representatives election was the process of electing the Speaker of the House of Representatives, which is the presiding officer of the United States House of Representatives. The election was held on January 3, 2023, and was the first of its kind in over a century.

Process and conventions

The Speaker of the House is elected by a majority vote of the members present in the House. The process begins with the nomination of candidates, usually by their respective parties. The candidate with the most votes among their party members is typically nominated as the party's candidate for Speaker.

Democratic nomination

### Candidates

The Democratic Party nominated Hakeem Jeffries for Speaker of the House. Jeffries is an American politician and lawyer who has served as a U.S. Representative for New York's 8th congressional district since 2013. He was elected as the House Minority Leader in 2019 and became the first African American to hold the position.

#### Nominee

Hakeem Jeffries was officially nominated as the Democratic Party's candidate for Speaker of the House on December 1, 2022.

* Nancy Pelosi (D-CA), the current Speaker of the House

### Result

Hakeem Jeffries was the only candidate to receive a majority of votes from the Democratic Party.

Republican nomination

The Republican Party nominated Kevin McCarthy for Speaker of the House. McCarthy is an American politician and businessman who has served as a U.S. Representative for California's 23rd congressional district since 2007.

Kevin McCarthy was officially nominated as the Republican Party's candidate for Speaker of the House on November 15, 2022.

The election for Speaker of the House was a contentious one, with multiple ballots required to determine the winner. The election was ultimately won by Hakeem Jeffries, who became the first African American to serve as Speaker of the House.
